snippet: Cutbacks in state provided unemployment benefits are hurting the most vulnerable and the economy.
abstract: Editorial scores Georgia for cutting back the duration of its jobless benefits from 26 weeks to 14 to 20 weeks, joining 10 other states that have done so; contends cutbacks in state provided unemployment benefits are hurting the most vulnerable and the economy; supports plan to forgive federal loans to states that rebuild their unemployment trust funds over several years.
lead_paragraph: Cutbacks in state provided unemployment benefits are hurting the most vulnerable and the economy.

headline.seo: Another Hole in the Safety Net for the Jobless
headline.main: Another Hole in the Safety Net
headline.print_headline: Another Hole in the Safety Net
